item.title: Israel strikes inside Iran, sources say
item.description: A person familiar with the situation told NBC News that Israel carried out an operation in Iran. Earlier, Israeli officials notified U.S. officials that a response was coming.

media:content.media:text: middle east map Israel Iran

item.title: Suspected Iran spy ship sails home as the world awaits a new Israeli attack
item.dc:creator: Matthew Mulligan
item.description: Suspected Iranian spy ship MV Behshad is sailing home — a move that comes as the world awaits Israel’s response to Tehran’s retaliatory attack.

media:content.media:text: Quds Day Rally In Tehran, Iran
media:content.media:description: An Iranian flag flies in downtown Tehran on April 14, 2023.

item.title: Google fires 28 workers for protesting $1.2 billion Israel contract
item.dc:creator: Mithil Aggarwal and Diana Dasrath
item.description: Google has fired more than two dozen employees for protesting its $1.2 billion contract to provide the Israeli government and military with cloud and artificial intelligence services.

media:content.media:text: Google employees protests at the company offices in Sunnyvale, Calif., in an image posted to social media on Wednesday.
media:content.media:description: Google employees protests at the company offices in Sunnyvale, Calif., in an image posted to social media on Wednesday.

item.title: Qatar re-evaluating its role as mediator in Gaza cease-fire talks
item.dc:creator: Reuters
item.description: Qatar is re-evaluating its role as mediator in cease-fire talks between Israel and the Palestinian militant group Hamas, citing concerns that its efforts are being undermined by politicians seeking to score points, its prime minister said on Wednesday.

media:content.media:text: Israeli bombardment in Rafah Gaza
media:content.media:description: Two Palestinians overlook a crater following an Israeli bombardment in Rafah, southern Gaza, on Thursday.

item.title: Class destroyed: A look at what has become of Gaza's revered universities
item.dc:creator: Chantal Da Silva and Yasmine Salam and Matthew Mulligan and Bianca Britton
item.description: Built over decades, Gaza’s universities embodied the ambitions of young Palestinians. In weeks, the Israeli military destroyed them.

item.title: She secretly educated herself to escape Afghanistan. Now, she's working to help women still there
item.dc:creator: Maya Eaglin
item.description: Sola Mahfouz stopped going to school in 2007 when she was an 11-year-old living in Afghanistan.

media:content.media:text: A portrait of Sola Mahfouz
media:content.media:description: Sola Mahfouz.

media:content.media:credit: Courtesy Sola Mahfouz and Malaina Kapoor
media:content.media:text: Sola Mahfouz and Malaina Kapour laugh while speaking.
media:content.media:description: Sola Mahfouz, left, and Malaina Kapoor.

media:content.media:credit: Courtesy Sola Mahfouz and Malaina Kapour
media:content.media:text: Sola Mahfouz and Malaina Kapour siting at a table and looking at a laptop.
media:content.media:description: Sola Mahfouz and Malaina Kapour.

item.title: Meet the families who've taken children as young as 2 to Everest Base Camp
item.dc:creator: Aria Bendix
item.description: A handful of families have taken children as young as 2 years old to Mount Everest Base Camp in recent years. Three of them describe the experience.

media:content.media:text: Hazel Matulis at Everest Base Camp in 2022.
media:content.media:description: Hazel Matulis at Everest Base Camp in 2022.

media:content.media:text: Dimple Laddha took her daughter, Arishka, last year when Arishka was just 6 years old.
media:content.media:description: Dimple Laddha took her daughter, Arishka, to Everest Base Camp last year at 6 years old.

media:content.media:text: Chris and Cindy Matulis with their kids at Everest Base Camp in 2022.
media:content.media:description: Chris and Cindy Matulis with their kids at Everest Base Camp in 2022.

media:content.media:text: Dimple Laddha took her daughter, Arishka, last year when Arishka was just 6 years old.

media:content.media:text: The Matulis kids at Everest Base Camp in 2022.
media:content.media:description: The Matulis kids at Everest Base Camp in 2022.

item.title: Looking for leads, not love: Job seekers in China turn Tinder into a networking tool
item.dc:creator: Larissa Gao and Helen Chen
item.description: Young people in China facing an increasingly tough labor market are turning to an unlikely place for help in their job searches: Tinder.

media:content.media:text: Photo Illustration: A man's Tinder profile reads "Looking for Full-tim employment"
media:content.media:description: Some young people in China see Tinder as a way to find potential job leads.

media:content.media:text: China Youth Unemployment
media:content.media:description: University students at a job fair in Wuhan, China, in March.

item.title: Retired U.S. general analyzes Israel’s potential options in response to Iran's drone attack
item.description: Retired four-star general Jospeh Votel analyzes Israel's options following Iran's drone attack on Saturday. Israel has vowed to retaliate even as the U.S. urges restraint.

media:content.media:title: Retired U.S. general analyzes Israel’s potential options in response to Iran's drone attack
media:content.media:description: Retired four-star general Jospeh Votel analyzes Israel's options following Iran's drone attack on Saturday. Israel has vowed to retaliate even as the U.S. urges restraint.

item.title: Hezbollah leader warns Israel will pay 'a high price' if Iran is attacked
item.description: Hezbollah's Deputy Secretary-General Naim Qassem tells NBC News' Matt Bradley Israel will "pay a high price" if they retaliate against Iran's recent aerial attacks.

media:content.media:title: Hezbollah leader warns Israel will pay 'a high price' if Iran is attacked
media:content.media:description: Hezbollah's Deputy Secretary-General Naim Qassem tells NBC News' Matt Bradley Israel will "pay a high price" if they retaliate against Iran's recent aerial attacks.

item.title: Video shows a Brazil woman trying to use a corpse to receive a bank loan
item.description: A Brazilian woman brought a 68-year-old man in a wheelchair into a bank branch and tried to get him to sign for a loan, but police said he had been dead for hours.

media:content.media:title: Video shows a Brazil woman trying to use a corpse to receive a bank loan
media:content.media:description: A Brazilian woman brought a 68-year-old man in a wheelchair into a bank branch and tried to get him to sign for a loan, but police said he had been dead for hours.

item.title: Assyrian bishop stabbed during a service in his Sydney church forgives his attacker
item.description: Bishop Mar Mari Emmanuel, the Assyrian bishop who was stabbed during a service at his Sydney church, said he was recovering quickly and that he had forgiven his attacker. The bishop's audio message came as Australian police arrested a suspect accused of rioting after the stabbing incident.

media:content.media:title: Assyrian bishop stabbed during a service in his Sydney church forgives his attacker
media:content.media:description: Bishop Mar Mari Emmanuel, the Assyrian bishop who was stabbed during a service at his Sydney church, said he was recovering quickly and that he had forgiven his attacker. The bishop's audio message came as Australian police arrested a suspect accused of rioting after the stabbing incident.

item.title: Catholic Church in communist Cuba proposes an open dialogue with the government
item.dc:creator: Orlando Matos and Carmen Sesin
item.description: In an interview with NBC News, the assistant secretary of the Conference of Catholic Bishops of Cuba is proposing a national dialogue to help resolve the economic crisis that has gripped the island.

media:content.media:text: Father Ariel Suárez
media:content.media:description: Father Ariel Suárez, assistant secretary of the Conference of Catholic Bishops of Cuba speaks with NBC News on April 18, 2024.

item.title: Man suspected of aiding Zelenskyy assassination plot arrested in Poland
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
item.description: A Polish man has been arrested on allegations of being ready to help Russia in an alleged plot to assassinate Ukraine’s President Volodymyr Zelenskyy.

media:content.media:text: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy arrived in Paris to sign a bilateral security agreement with France hours after he officialized a similar one with Germany.
media:content.media:description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy in Paris in February.

item.title: Scotland pauses prescriptions of puberty blockers for transgender minors
item.dc:creator: Matt Lavietes
item.description: Scotland’s sole clinic for treating transgender youths announced Thursday that it is pausing new prescriptions of puberty blockers for minors.

media:content.media:text: Trans rights activists attend a protest in London
media:content.media:description: Trans rights activists attend a protest in London on Jan. 21, 2023.

item.title: Germany arrests men accused of spying on U.S. military sites for Russia in sabotage plot to undermine Ukraine aid
item.dc:creator: Carlo Angerer and Patrick Smith and The Associated Press and Yuliya Talmazan
item.description: Two arrested in Germany on suspicion of spying for Russia and collecting information on targets including U.S. military facilities to undermine Ukraine aid, authorities said Thursday.

media:content.media:text: Germany arrests men who allegedly spied on U.S. military sites for Russia in sabotage plot to undermine Ukraine aid
media:content.media:description: Ukraine has long warned that Russian spies were active across Europe.

item.title: Prince Harry now officially considers the U.S. — not Britain — his primary residence
item.dc:creator: Patrick Smith
item.description: Prince Harry now officially considers himself a resident of the United States, according to a new U.K. regulatory filing.

media:content.media:text: Britain's Prince Harry participates in the Royal Salute Polo Challenge, in Wellington
media:content.media:description: Prince Harry and Meghan, the Duchess of Sussex, moved to the U.S. in 2020.

item.title: Dubai clears up after epic rains swamp glitzy desert city
item.dc:creator: Reuters
item.description: Dubai, a city in the desert proud of its futuristic gloss, was on Thursday busy clearing its waterlogged roads and drying out flooded homes two days after a record storm saw a year’s rain fall in a day.

media:content.media:text: Image: Dubai Cleans Up After Heavy Rains And Flooding
media:content.media:description: Abandoned vehicles on a flooded highway in Dubai on April 18, 2024.

media:content.media:text: Image: Dubai Cleans Up After Heavy Rains And Flooding
media:content.media:description: People push a stalled car through a flooded highway in Dubai.

media:content.media:text: An abandoned vehicle on a flooded highway after a rainstorm in Dubai, United Arab Emirates, on Wednesday, April 17, 2024.
media:content.media:description: The United Arab Emirates experienced its heaviest downpour since records began in 1949, Dubai's media office said in a statement.

item.title: Trump says 'We're behind Poland' as he meets with President Andrzej Duda
item.dc:creator: Reuters
item.description: Polish President Andrzej Duda discussed Ukraine and the Middle East with Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump during a meeting in New York on Wednesday at which the former U.S. president said he was “behind Poland all the way.”

media:content.media:text: Donald Trump Meets With Polish President Duda At Trump Tower
media:content.media:description: Former President Donald Trump meets with Polish President Andrzej Duda at Trump Tower in New York City on Wednesday night.

item.title: Prominent figure in German far-right party stands trial over alleged use of Nazi slogan
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
item.description: One of the most prominent figures in the far-right Alternative for Germany party arrived in court Thursday for his trial on charges of using a Nazi slogan, months before a regional election in which he is running to become his state’s governor.

media:content.media:text: Bjoern Hoecke Goes On Trial For Using Nazi-Era Terminology
media:content.media:description: Björn Höcke arrives at court Thursday in Halle, Germany.

item.title: Stabbed Sydney bishop says he forgives attacker
item.dc:creator: Reuters
item.description: An Assyrian church bishop who was stabbed during a service at his church said on Thursday he was recovering quickly, and that he had forgiven his attacker as police ramped up investigation into the riots triggered after the bishop’s stabbing.

media:content.media:text: Handout photo of Bishop Mar Mari Emmanuel
media:content.media:description: Bishop Mar Mari Emmanuel, right, during the 2023 Holy Resurrection Feast services, in Sydney.

media:content.media:text: Police Investigate Terror Attack At Sydney Church
media:content.media:description: A forensics officer takes swabs at Christ The Good Shepherd Church in the Sydney suburb of Wakeley on Tuesday.

item.title: The number of hostages still alive in Gaza is a mystery, officials say
item.dc:creator: Dan De Luce and Peter Alexander and Monica Alba and Anna Schecter and Lawahez Jabari
item.description: More than six months after Hamas' attack on Israel, it remains unclear exactly how many of the hostages are still alive in Gaza, U.S. and Israeli officials say.

media:content.media:text: Relatives and supporters of Israeli hostages held in Gaza protest in front of the Israeli parliament
media:content.media:description: Relatives and supporters of Israeli hostages held in Gaza protest in front of the Israeli parliament in Jerusalem on April 7.

item.title: India kicks off the world's largest elections this week. Here's what you need to know.
item.dc:creator: Charmaine Jacob, CNBC and Joanna Tan, CNBC
item.description: Indians head to the polls Friday in the world’s largest democratic election, as almost a billion voters decide whether to re-elect Prime Minister Narendra Modi.

media:content.media:text: Indians head to the polls on Friday in what will be the world’s largest democratic election, as close to one billion voters pick their next government and decide whether to hand Prime Minister Narendra Modi a third term in office.
media:content.media:description: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi at an election campaign event in Chennai on April 9.

item.title: China slams U.S. probe into its shipbuilding industry, calling it a ‘mistake on top of a mistake’
item.dc:creator: Sheila Chiang, CNBC
item.description: China said it “firmly opposes” the U.S. investigation into its maritime, logistics and shipbuilding industries, calling it a “mistake on top of a mistake.”

media:content.media:text: Ship Repair Underway In Guangzhou's Shipyard
media:content.media:description: Workers hoist a propeller at a COSCO shipyard in Guangzhou, China, last month.

item.title: USC decision to cancel Muslim valedictorian's speech further inflames tensions on campus
item.dc:creator: Alicia Victoria Lozano
item.description: University of Southern California students said their hopes were dashed this week when the school canceled Muslim student Asna Tabassum 's commencement address.

media:content.media:text: portrait usc valedictorian speech change
media:content.media:description: Asna Tabassum, a graduating senior, on the USC campus on April 16, 2024.
